docs.lead_paragraph: AZTAR said yesterday that it had agreed to Pinnacle Entertainment's increased takeover offer of $51 a share in cash and stock. Pinnacle valued the deal at about $1.97 billion in equity and $677 million in debt. Aztar, owner of the Tropicana casinos in Las Vegas and Atlantic City, said a previous $50-a-share cash offer from Columbia Sussex, a hotel and casino owner, was no longer a superior proposal under the merger agreement with Pinnacle. The deal with Pinnacle, which is based in Las Vegas, included $47 a share in cash and $4 a share in stock.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Dr. Arnold S. Relman (letter, May 4), for whom I have great deal of respect, provides three reasons we should not just convert our entire health care system to Medicare in his response to Paul Krugman's May 1 column. But none of his concerns should stop us.
docs.abstract: Dr Herbert H Keyser letter rebuts Dr Arnold Relman's May 4 letter opposing converting entire health care system to Medicare, as discussed in Paul Krugman's May 1 column

docs.lead_paragraph: Maybe They'll Rename It the Run for the Feathers Deborah Dadiani of New York City added to the atmosphere at Churchill Downs, site of the Kentucky Derby today. SPORTSSATURDAY, PAGE D1 Stung by Big Election Losses, Blair Reshuffles His Cabinet In response to Labor Party losses in local elections, Prime Minister Tony Blair carried out a sweeping reorganization of the British cabinet, replacing Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and Home Secretary Charles Clarke. Some in the party called for Mr. Blair to step down. PAGE A4 Cheney Visits Kazakhstan A day after scolding Moscow for its energy policies, Vice President Dick Cheney visited Kazakhstan to promote export routes to directly supply the West. PAGE A6 Las Vegas Strip's New Luxury The Strip, once home to the low-cost weekend getaway with free drinks and the $1.99 shrimp cocktail, is giving way to high-priced luxury hotels. PAGE C1 Book for Ex-C.I.A. Officer Valerie Wilson, the former C.I.A. officer whose identity was revealed, agreed to a book deal worth about $2.5 million, people involved in the bidding said. THE ARTS, PAGE B8 Feeling Pinch of Daily Costs Though they may not fear for their jobs or worry about long-range financial health, many Americans are now feeling squeezed by high gasoline prices, mortgage rates and insurance costs. PAGE A11 THIS WEEKEND A Season for Cinema A special section features a private tour of the Louvre, scene of ''The Da Vinci Code''; Paul Giamatti and Toni Collette; five breakthrough performances; and a complete rundown of the season. ARTS & LEISURE On the Road to Mandalay Those who venture to Myanmar will discover an ancient land yet untouched by chain restaurants and boutique hotels. TRAVEL

docs.lead_paragraph: FALLS CHURCH, Va. — It was 7:30 on a recent weekday, and a dozen small-business owners, coffee and muffins in hand, were already hard at work on how they were going to win Congressional relief for their No. 1 problem: rising health care costs.
